intro: Lagochilus, commonly known as wild thyme or mountain thyme, is a genus of flowering plants in the Lamiaceae family. It consists of approximately 100 species, predominantly found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants are typically shrubs or herbs with aromatic, often hairy leaves and small, tubular flowers. They are known for their medicinal and culinary uses, particularly in traditional herbal remedies. Lagochilus species are valued for their resilience to harsh environments and their ability to thrive in rocky or arid soils.
